net.openhft.lang.io.serialization

Interface BytesMarshaller<E>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CompactBytesMarshaller<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteBufferMarshaller, ByteBufferZMarshaller, BytesMarshallableMarshaller, ClassMarshaller, CompactEnumBytesMarshaller, DateMarshaller, EnumBytesMarshaller, ExternalizableMarshaller, GenericEnumMarshaller, ListMarshaller, MapMarshaller, NoMarshaller, SetMarshaller, SnappyStringMarshaller, StringMarshaller, StringZMapMarshaller

    public interface BytesMarshaller<E>
extends Serializable
    External marshaller for classes. From design patterns point of view, this interface is marshalling strategy.
    Author:
    peter.lawrey
    See Also:
    BytesMarshallable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      E read(Bytes bytes)
      Reads and returns an object from bytes.
      E read(Bytes bytes, E e)
      Reads and returns an object from bytes, reusing the given object, if possible.
      void write(Bytes bytes, E e)
      Write the object out to the bytes.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(Bytes bytes,
           E e)
        Write the object out to the bytes.
        Parameters:
        bytes - to write to
        e - the object to write

      • read

        @Nullable
E read(Bytes bytes)
        Reads and returns an object from bytes.
        Parameters:
        bytes - to read
        Returns:
        the read object

      • read

        @Nullable
E read(Bytes bytes,
                  @Nullable
                  E e)
        Reads and returns an object from bytes, reusing the given object, if possible.
        Parameters:
        bytes - to read
        e - an object to reuse, if possible. null could be passed, in this case a new object should be allocated anyway.
        Returns:
        the read object
